chapter.p: 1Ah! Those who go down to Egypt for help!

ul.li1: and trust in chariots because they are many,
ul.li2: and in horsemen because they are very numerous,
ul.li1: and they do not look to the holy one of Israel,
ul.li2: and they do not consult Yahweh.
ul.li1: 2And indeed, he is wise, and he brings disaster,
ul.li2: and he does not remove his words,
ul.li1: and he will rise against the house of evildoers
ul.li2: and against the help of workers of iniquity.
ul.li1: 3And the Egyptians are human and not God,
ul.li2: and their horses are flesh and not spirit.
ul.li1: And Yahweh stretches out his hand,
and the one being helped will fall,
ul.li2: and together all of them will come to an end.Or “perish”
and a young lion over its prey

chapter.p: when a full groupLiterally “fullness” of shepherds is called against him,

ul.li1: it is not terrified by their voice,
ul.li2: and to their noise it does not respond,
ul.li1: so Yahweh of hosts will come down to fight upon Mount Zion

chapter.p: 5Like birds flying overhead, so Yahweh of hosts will protect Jerusalem;

ul.li1: he will protect and deliver it;
ul.li2: he will pass over and rescue it.

chapter.p: 6Turn back to the one against whom the sons of Israel have made deep rebellion.

ul.li1: 7For on that day, each one will reject his idols of silver
ul.li2: and his idols of gold which your hands have made in sin for you.
ul.li1: 8And Assyria shall fall by a sword not of a man,
ul.li2: and a sword not of a human shall devour him;
ul.li1: and he shall flee from the sword,
ul.li2: and his young men shall be put to forced labor.
ul.li1: 9And his rock will pass over because of terror,
ul.li2: and his officers will be terrified because of the flag,”
ul.li1: who has a fire in Zion
ul.li2: and has a furnace in Jerusalem.
